intro: Rhagadiolus lapsana, commonly known as common viper's bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Rhagadiolus lapsana is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
